 For the first time in the history of Television, a mammoth effort covering the entire gamut on Indian Culture, Heritage, Philosophy and Wisdom spanning more than 5000 years has been produced as a television serial titled 'Upanishad Ganga'.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœUpanishad GangaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, is an all-inclusive picture of society, covering people from all walks of life be it kings, commoners, rishis, gods, saints and the so called sinners. This serial innovatively employs 3 mediums Ã¢â‚¬â€œ stories, theatre and television. A riveting feature of this serial is the concept of the Great Indian Theatre through which ancient Indian wisdom is shared with the common man, in a style that at once synergises the traditional with the modern.

 The term 'Upanishad' literally means 'sitting nearby' or 'sitting close to', and implies 'knowledge'. The context referred to is when disciples desirous of permanent happiness sat at the feet of a perfect master and imbibed the knowledge of the eternal Truth. The episodes of Upanishad Ganga throw light on the queries that plague us. In fact they hold a perfect mirror to our souls and unravel the secrets of our deeper selves. 

Ã¢â‚¬ËœUpanishad GangaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is conceptualised by Swami Tejomayananda, head of Chinmaya Mission Worldwide. Written and directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi and co-written by Farid Khan, with valuable inputs and assistance from acharyas of Chinmaya Mission. The intensive research itself extended to four years which is evident in the detailing of the costume design, the art direction and the character depiction. Many eras have been recreated spanning the Vedic period, the Mughal era and the present times. The serial is an attempt to pave the way for our understanding of Indian culture and nourish human values that are so relevant in the present times. No efforts have been spared to make this serial memorable in all aspects Ã¢â‚¬â€ concept clarity, thought development, execution, effective picturisation, quality depiction and the best artists such as Abhimanyu Singh, Zakir Hussain, K. K. Raina, , Ila Arun, and Jaya Bhattacharya among others. 

 Insights on ideas such as the glory of human birth, right living, painful attachment, work ethics, personality types and so on are shared in a simple yet revealing manner through the 52 episodes.Upanishad Ganga will be telecast on the Indian National Channel (Doordarshan National) from March 11th, 2012 on Sunday mornings (10 am-10.30 am).
